title: Huge Lag Spikes
body:
Microsoft Windows [Version 6.1.7601]
Copyright (c) 2009 Microsoft Corporation.  All rights reserved.

C:\Users\Chris>tracert 104.160.131.3

Tracing route to 104.160.131.3 over a maximum of 30 hops

  1     3 ms     4 ms     2 ms  192.168.0.1
  2    49 ms     *       19 ms  cpe-70-113-96-1.austin.res.rr.com [70.113.96.1]

  3   236 ms   194 ms   204 ms  cpe-70-113-96-1.austin.res.rr.com [70.113.96.1]

  4   723 ms   192 ms   176 ms  tge0-0-13.rdrktxaz02h.texas.rr.com [24.27.13.61]

  5   300 ms   304 ms   284 ms  agg32.ausxtxir02r.texas.rr.com [24.175.43.239]
  6   191 ms   188 ms   180 ms  agg22.hstqtxl301r.texas.rr.com [24.175.41.48]
  7    32 ms    31 ms    33 ms  bu-ether16.hstqtx0209w-bcr00.tbone.rr.com [66.10
9.6.108]
  8    52 ms    39 ms    37 ms  bu-ether12.dllstx976iw-bcr00.tbone.rr.com [66.10
9.6.39]
  9    32 ms    24 ms    29 ms  0.ae1.pr1.dfw10.tbone.rr.com [107.14.17.234]
 10   172 ms   190 ms   186 ms  24.27.236.233
 11   298 ms   276 ms   259 ms  104.160.134.35
 12   130 ms   137 ms   124 ms  ae35-br02.chi01.riotdirect.net [104.160.159.24]

 13    49 ms    47 ms    49 ms  104.160.131.3

Trace complete.
____________________________________________________________

So it looks as if the problem is my ISP and Riot... anything I can do?

replies.body:
It definitely looks like there are issues along the roadrunner network before your connection hits our servers. I'd recommend working with your ISP and provide this traceroute so they have more context on this issue. Hopefully they'll be able to launch an investigation and assist you in resolving this for good.

Let me know if you have any questions.
Really the only thing you can do is change your internet service, whether it's upgrading your service, router, modem, etc or getting a whole new provider all together.
